meanings.definition: Being in an early period of life or growth.
meanings.sent1: The puppy is so cute and playful because it is younger.
meanings.sent2: My sister is younger than me by two years.
meanings.sent3: The younger kids at the party were having a blast playing tag.
meanings.sent4: The younger trees in the forest swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The younger students in the class were eager to learn new things.

meanings.definition: More youthful or junior in age.
meanings.sent1: The kitten looked so tiny and energetic because it was younger.
meanings.sent2: She always hangs out with the younger crowd at school.
meanings.sent3: The younger members of the team brought fresh ideas to the project.
meanings.sent4: The younger flowers in the garden bloomed brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The younger athletes showed great potential in the competition.

meanings.definition: Of more recent origin or arrival.
meanings.sent1: The younger students just transferred to our school last week.
meanings.sent2: The newer model of the phone is younger and more advanced.
meanings.sent3: The younger guests at the event were excited to explore the venue.
meanings.sent4: The younger stars in the sky sparkled with a fresh brightness.
meanings.sent5: The younger buildings in the city showcased modern architecture.
